results.title: Effective office communication: trainers manual [text]
results.brief_description: The manual which accompanies program of the same title contains a transcript of the dramatised episode which highlights problems with office communication and outlines some strategies to improve it. Each section of the text gives a brief introduction to the topic and presents a discussion exercise for consideration. Topics include: purposeful communication, the two-way process of communication, planning and establishing regular communication practices, the value of written communication, confidentiality, follow-up communication and using praise to motivate. The video tape may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Effective office communication
results.brief_description: A vignette emphasises important aspects of office communication highlighting the different types of communication found in the workplace such as memos, faxes and telephone messages; the importance of two-way communication; maintaining confidentiality in some types of communication; the importance of praise and good news as a tool for motivating staff and procedures and practices to enhance communication in an organisation. A trainer’s manual accompanies the program and is available as a separate loan item.

results.title: Effective meeting participation
results.brief_description: This program aims to instruct people about the knowledge and skills required to fully understand the structure of meetings, as well as appreciating that it’s an opportunity for contribution to the ongoing development of the organisation. It covers the importance of defining the purpose of the meeting and establishing goals related to the purpose, the benefits of preparation, including developing possible responses, as well as covering the concept that meetings are a forum for negotiation and consensus, as distinct from argument and conflict.

results.title: Edweard Muybridge Horse in Motion
results.brief_description: Muybridge was the first person to render time visible by breaking movement down into increments of time – influencing artists to the present day.

constellations_primary.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_primary.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

results.description: In reducing shutter speeds down to a fraction of a second, Eadweard Muybridge broke down movement into increments of time. With multiple cameras, Muybridge was able to take sequential photographs – then with the help of a zoetrope and later his zoopraxiscope he effectively created the world’s first moving photographs laying the foundation for creation of the moving image.
description_for_label: In reducing shutter speeds down to a fraction of a second, Eadweard Muybridge broke down movement into increments of time. With multiple cameras, Muybridge was able to take sequential photographs – then with the help of a zoetrope and later his zoopraxiscope he effectively created the world’s first moving photographs laying the foundation for creation of the moving image.

results.title: Edward Said (Writers in Conversation)
results.brief_description: Edward Said, through much of his work, is concerned with the identity of the Palestinians, a dispersed and dispossessed people attempting to come to terms with exile. In this interview with Salman Rushdie, Edward Said explains the history and evolution of the Palestinian people.
results.description: Edward Said, through much of his work, is concerned with the identity of the Palestinians, a dispersed and dispossessed people attempting to come to terms with exile. results.title: Edward Presley: a man of assurance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Pattern of People”.
Edward Presley is one of the many people employed by Lloyds of London. This film examines the history and present day operations of the largest insurance company in the world. Narrated by James Mason

results.title: Eden
results.brief_description: Eden is an old growth forest in the Mount Kosciusko region of N.S.W.’s South-East that is still being logged today. Benjamin Cruse, the narator and member of Eden Land Council, tells of the efforts being made to save the remainder of the forest from total devastation. An Aboriginal man whose ancestors belonged to the region, Cruz describes the logging companies attitude towards the land as being connected and the same to the attitude of the ‘settlers’ toward indigenous people. The Aboriginal relationship with the land in Australia is described as being the ‘original human relationship’, the land is where the spirit is born and returns to upon death.

results.title: Ed Thorgersen's sports review: playtime in Hawaii
results.creator_credit: Truman Talley and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine showing various outdoor recreation in Hawaii: net fishing from the rocky shores; mud sliding; arm wrestling; gymnastics; rugby; horseback riding along Honolulu’s shoreline; sailing; surfing; outrigger canoes.
